repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
â€¢ |default-autocmds|: set up |vim.hl.on_yank()|. To disable this, delete the "nvim.yank" event group: `:autocmd! nvim.yank`
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,7 @@ DEFAULTS
   was implemented as an internal C routine).
 â€¢ Project-local configuration ('exrc') is also loaded from parent directories.
   Unset 'exrc' to stop further search.
+â€¢ |default-autocmds|: set up |vim.hl.on_yank()|.

comment_data.body: is 150 ms really enough? I have been using 300 ms

150ms is the default (which I've been using, no surprise) -- we can of course raise that if we think 300ms is better. (I'm fine with either, I just don't think we should enable it with non-default settings.)
let's try changing the default to 300ms
Chiming in here. 300 feels really slow to me... I have been using 100, but am more than happy with the default just staying 150

comment_regular_data.body:
For failing oldtest, we should probably simply clear the autocommand at the start of the test (@zeertzjq ?)

How should I proceed with the three failing functionaltests?
I would say drop the nvim.yank augroup in the test harness by default.
Just add another `autocmd!` in after setup.vim line 70

> I would say drop the nvim.yank augroup in the test harness by default.

Where would I do that for the functionaltests?

**EDIT** The `nvim.terminal` autocommands are manually removed at the start of some tests; I think I'll just follow their example.

> Where would I do that for the functionaltests?

here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1bf9a07b3e77dbb6cefeefd9febdc3db8d52a313/test/functional/testnvim.lua#L25

we can try it as you have it, but I wonder if a timed highlight will cause flakiness in tests that perform yanks, which I assume is somewhat common.
Let's see what the final tests say.
Fifth time is the charm ðŸ˜Œ

I think the autocommand should be removed globally for functionaltests as well in `nvim_set`, because it:
- Causes short-lived screen updates that may lead to test flakiness (in both existing and future tests).
- Starts a timer that may delay Nvim exit with ASAN, making tests slower.
Ok, that didn't work. @zeertzjq could you please tell me the exact change needed here?
Hmm, the same command is repeated twice?
No, and you are making such a change to a test that already passes.
Ok, so I missed the correct instance; there's a bunch in this test. Do you know the correct one?

I'm not sure what's going on, but moving the autocommand before the tty block seems to solve the problem:
```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/_defaults.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/_defaults.lua
index cf6847c2eb..11e4d9528c 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/_defaults.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/_defaults.lua
@@ -666,6 +666,45 @@ do
     end,
   })
 
+  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('VimEnter', {
+    group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.find_exrc', {}),
+    desc = 'Find exrc files in parent directories',
+    callback = function()
+      if not vim.o.exrc then
+        return
+      end
+      local files = vim.fs.find({ '.nvim.lua', '.nvimrc', '.exrc' }, {
+        type = 'file',
+        upward = true,
+        limit = math.huge,
+        -- exrc in cwd already handled from C, thus start in parent directory.
+        path = vim.fs.dirname((vim.uv.cwd())),
+      })
+      for _, file in ipairs(files) do
+        local trusted = vim.secure.read(file) --[[@as string|nil]]
+        if trusted then
+          if vim.endswith(file, '.lua') then
+            assert(loadstring(trusted))()
+          else
+            vim.api.nvim_exec2(trusted, {})
+          end
+        end
+        -- If the user unset 'exrc' in the current exrc then stop searching
+        if not vim.o.exrc then
+          return
+        end
+      end
+    end,
+  })
+
+  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('TextYankPost', {
+    group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.yank', {}),
+    desc = 'Highlight yanked text',
+    callback = function()
+      vim.hl.on_yank()
+    end,
+  })
+
   -- Only do the following when the TUI is attached
   local tty = nil
   for _, ui in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_list_uis()) do
@@ -933,45 +972,6 @@ do
       end
     end
   end
-
-  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('VimEnter', {
-    group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.find_exrc', {}),
-    desc = 'Find exrc files in parent directories',
-    callback = function()
-      if not vim.o.exrc then
-        return
-      end
-      local files = vim.fs.find({ '.nvim.lua', '.nvimrc', '.exrc' }, {
-        type = 'file',
-        upward = true,
-        limit = math.huge,
-        -- exrc in cwd already handled from C, thus start in parent directory.
-        path = vim.fs.dirname((vim.uv.cwd())),
-      })
-      for _, file in ipairs(files) do
-        local trusted = vim.secure.read(file) --[[@as string|nil]]
-        if trusted then
-          if vim.endswith(file, '.lua') then
-            assert(loadstring(trusted))()
-          else
-            vim.api.nvim_exec2(trusted, {})
-          end
-        end
-        -- If the user unset 'exrc' in the current exrc then stop searching
-        if not vim.o.exrc then
-          return
-        end
-      end
-    end,
-  })
-
-  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('TextYankPost', {
-    group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.yank', {}),
-    desc = 'Highlight yanked text',
-    callback = function()
-      vim.hl.on_yank()
-    end,
-  })
 end
 
 --- Default options
```
Not sure why that should make a difference but I'll take it.

title: feat(defaults): set up highlight on yank
